item.title: How to change loading bar color?
item.dc:creator: @powerade powerade
item.description:
@powerade wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:3, topic:4170”]1. Open up client.java

  1. Search for 8C1111 there is only 2 places and both you can edit for this. The first one you find is for the frame and the second one is for the loading bar.

  2. Chage it to a hex code you want. Example for purple it will be 0xBD04EB instead of 0x8C1111. So write the hex code after the 0x.

(thanks, Cheeter)[/quote] THANKS UNCLE PAUL!!!
i would rep if i can

EDIT: ohh i got cyan color whats code for that? Im using blakescape client source thats supports up to 369
EDIT again: never mind i found thanks paul!

Read full topic
item.source: How to change loading bar color?

item.title: How to change loading bar color?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

  1. Open up client.java

  2. Search for 8C1111 there is only 2 places and both you can edit for this. The first one you find is for the frame and the second one is for the loading bar.

  3. Chage it to a hex code you want. Example for purple it will be 0xBD04EB instead of 0x8C1111. So write the hex code after the 0x.

(thanks, Cheeter)

item.title: How to change loading bar color?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Yeah. Change the hex code for the loading bar in client.java. There’s one for the outline and one for the main color.
